instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates basic noise generators
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; noise opcode: ares noise xamp, ibeta
    ; noise generates white or colored noise
    ; xamp - amplitude
    ; ibeta - spectral color (0=white, 1=pink, approaching infinity=brown)
    
    ; White noise
    iAmp = 0.3
    aNoise noise iAmp, 0
    
    outs aNoise, aNoise
endin

instr 2
    ; Pink noise
    iAmp = 0.3
    aNoise noise iAmp, 1
    
    outs aNoise, aNoise
endin

instr 3
    ; Brown noise
    iAmp = 0.3
    aNoise noise iAmp, 2
    
    outs aNoise, aNoise
endin

instr 4
    ; rand opcode: ares rand xamp [, iseed] [, isel] [, ioffset]
    ; rand generates pseudo-random numbers at audio rate
    ; xamp - amplitude range
    
    iAmp = 0.3
    aNoise rand iAmp
    
    outs aNoise, aNoise
endin

instr 5
    ; randh opcode: ares randh xamp, xcps [, iseed] [, isize] [, ioffset]
    ; randh generates random values with sample-and-hold
    ; xamp - amplitude range
    ; xcps - frequency of new random values
    
    iAmp = 0.3
    iRate = 500
    
    aNoise randh iAmp, iRate
    
    outs aNoise, aNoise
endin

instr 6
    ; randi opcode: ares randi xamp, xcps [, iseed] [, isize] [, ioffset]
    ; randi generates random values with interpolation
    ; xamp - amplitude range
    ; xcps - frequency of new random values
    
    iAmp = 0.3
    iRate = 500
    
    aNoise randi iAmp, iRate
    
    outs aNoise, aNoise
endin

instr 7
    ; pinkish opcode: ares pinkish xin [, imethod] [, inumbands] [, iseed] [, iskip]
    ; pinkish generates pink noise
    ; xin - input signal to colorize (typically white noise)
    
    ; Generate white noise first
    aWhite noise 1, 0
    
    ; Convert to pink
    aPink pinkish aWhite
    
    outs aPink*0.3, aPink*0.3
endin

instr 8
    ; Variable rate randh
    iAmp = 0.3
    
    ; Rate changes over time
    kRate linseg 100, p3, 5000
    
    aNoise randh iAmp, kRate
    
    outs aNoise, aNoise
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play white noise
i1 0 2

; Play pink noise
i2 2.5 2

; Play brown noise
i3 5 2

; Play rand
i4 7.5 2

; Play randh
i5 10 2

; Play randi
i6 12.5 2

; Play pinkish
i7 15 2

; Play variable rate
i8 17.5 3

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates random number generators for control signals
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

giSine ftgen 1, 0, 16384, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; random opcode: kres random kmin, kmax
    ; random generates random values between min and max at k-rate
    ; kmin, kmax - range
    
    iAmp = 0.4
    
    ; Random frequency changes
    kFreq random 200, 800
    
    aOsc poscil iAmp, kFreq, giSine
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

instr 2
    ; randomh opcode: kres randomh kmin, kmax, kcps [, imode] [, ifirstval]
    ; randomh generates sample-and-hold random values at k-rate
    ; kmin, kmax - range
    ; kcps - rate of new values
    
    iAmp = 0.4
    
    ; Random frequency at 8 Hz rate
    kFreq randomh 300, 700, 8
    
    aOsc poscil iAmp, kFreq, giSine
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

instr 3
    ; randomi (interpolated random)
    iAmp = 0.4
    
    ; Smooth random frequency changes
    kFreq randomi 250, 750, 6
    
    aOsc poscil iAmp, kFreq, giSine
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

instr 4
    ; Random amplitude modulation
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; Random amplitude
    kAmp randomh 0.2, 0.5, 4
    
    aOsc poscil kAmp, iFreq, giSine
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

instr 5
    ; Random pan position
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = p4
    
    aOsc poscil iAmp, iFreq, giSine
    
    ; Random pan (0 to 1)
    kPan randomh 0, 1, 3
    
    aLeft = aOsc * sqrt(1 - kPan)
    aRight = aOsc * sqrt(kPan)
    
    outs aLeft, aRight
endin

instr 6
    ; Stochastic melody
    ; Random note selection
    kFreq randomh 220, 880, 5
    kFreq = int(kFreq / 50) * 50  ; Quantize to steps
    
    ; Random amplitude
    kAmp randomh 0.2, 0.4, 5
    
    aOsc poscil kAmp, kFreq, giSine
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

instr 7
    ; Multiple random parameters
    ; Random frequency
    kFreq randomi 200, 800, 4
    
    ; Random amplitude
    kAmp randomh 0.2, 0.5, 6
    
    ; Random filter cutoff
    kCutoff randomh 500, 3000, 3
    
    aOsc poscil kAmp, kFreq, giSine
    aFiltered butterlp aOsc, kCutoff
    
    outs aFiltered, aFiltered
endin

instr 8
    ; Brownian motion (smooth random walk)
    iAmp = 0.4
    
    ; Accumulating random steps
    kStep randomi -20, 20, 10
    kFreq init 440
    kFreq = kFreq + kStep
    
    ; Limit range
    kFreq limit kFreq, 200, 800
    
    aOsc poscil iAmp, kFreq, giSine
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play random frequency
i1 0 3

; Play randomh frequency
i2 3.5 3

; Play randomi frequency
i3 7 3

; Play random amplitude
i4 10.5 3 440

; Play random pan
i5 14 3 523

; Play stochastic melody
i6 17.5 4

; Play multiple random
i7 22 4

; Play Brownian motion
i8 26.5 5

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates advanced noise synthesis techniques
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

giSine ftgen 1, 0, 16384, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; Filtered noise sweep
    iAmp = 0.4
    
    ; White noise source
    aNoise noise 1, 0
    
    ; Sweeping filter
    kCutoff expseg 200, p3, 8000
    
    aFiltered butterbp aNoise, kCutoff, kCutoff*0.3
    
    outs aFiltered*iAmp, aFiltered*iAmp
endin

instr 2
    ; Granular noise texture
    iAmp = 0.3
    
    ; Random grain generation
    kTrig metro 20
    kDur randomh 0.05, 0.2, 20
    kAmp randomh 0.5, 1, 20
    
    ; Noise burst
    aNoise noise 1, 0
    aEnv linseg 0, 0.01, 1, kDur-0.02, 1, 0.01, 0
    
    aGrain = aNoise * aEnv * kAmp * iAmp
    
    outs aGrain, aGrain
endin

instr 3
    ; Noise-based percussion
    iAmp = 0.5
    
    ; Short noise burst
    aNoise noise 1, 0
    
    ; Exponential decay envelope
    aEnv expseg 1, 0.01, 0.5, 0.05, 0.01, p3-0.06, 0.001
    
    ; Filter sweep (high to low)
    kCutoff expseg 8000, p3, 200
    
    aFiltered butterlp aNoise, kCutoff
    aDrum = aFiltered * aEnv * iAmp
    
    outs aDrum, aDrum
endin

instr 4
    ; Wind sound
    iAmp = 0.3
    
    ; Pink noise base
    aWhite noise 1, 0
    aPink pinkish aWhite
    
    ; Slow amplitude modulation
    kMod randomi 0.6, 1, 0.5
    
    ; Gentle filtering
    aFiltered butterlp aPink, 2000
    
    aWind = aFiltered * kMod * iAmp
    
    outs aWind, aWind
endin

instr 5
    ; Ocean waves
    iAmp = 0.3
    
    ; Brown noise (low frequency emphasis)
    aNoise noise 1, 2
    
    ; Wave-like amplitude envelope
    kWave poscil 0.5, 0.3, giSine
    kWave = 0.5 + kWave
    
    ; Low-pass filter
    aFiltered butterlp aNoise, 800
    
    aOcean = aFiltered * kWave * iAmp
    
    outs aOcean, aOcean
endin

instr 6
    ; Crackling fire
    iAmp = 0.3
    
    ; High-rate sample and hold
    aCrackle randh 1, 3000
    
    ; Add some filtering
    aFiltered butterbp aCrackle, 2000, 1000
    
    ; Random amplitude bursts
    kBurst randomh 0.3, 1, 8
    
    aFire = aFiltered * kBurst * iAmp
    
    outs aFire, aFire
endin

instr 7
    ; Vinyl crackle
    iAmp = 0.15
    
    ; Very high rate randh for crackle
    aCrackle randh 1, 8000
    
    ; High-pass to remove low frequencies
    aFiltered butterhp aCrackle, 3000
    
    ; Lower overall level
    aVinyl = aFiltered * iAmp
    
    outs aVinyl, aVinyl
endin

instr 8
    ; Metallic noise (resonant)
    iAmp = 0.35
    
    ; White noise
    aNoise noise 1, 0
    
    ; Multiple resonant filters
    aRes1 butterbp aNoise, 1200, 50
    aRes2 butterbp aNoise, 2400, 60
    aRes3 butterbp aNoise, 4800, 80
    
    ; Decay envelope
    aEnv expseg 1, p3, 0.001
    
    aMetal = (aRes1 + aRes2 + aRes3) * aEnv * iAmp
    
    outs aMetal, aMetal
endin

instr 9
    ; Stereo noise field
    iAmp = 0.3
    
    ; Independent noise for each channel
    aNoiseL noise 1, 0
    aNoiseR noise 1, 0, 1
    
    ; Different filtering per channel
    kCutL randomi 500, 3000, 2
    kCutR randomi 600, 3500, 2.3
    
    aLeft butterlp aNoiseL, kCutL
    aRight butterlp aNoiseR, kCutR
    
    outs aLeft*iAmp, aRight*iAmp
endin

instr 10
    ; Noise with pitch tracking
    iAmp = 0.3
    
    ; Fundamental frequency
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; Noise source
    aNoise noise 1, 0
    
    ; Bandpass at fundamental and harmonics
    aFund butterbp aNoise, iFreq, iFreq*0.1
    aHarm2 butterbp aNoise, iFreq*2, iFreq*0.15
    aHarm3 butterbp aNoise, iFreq*3, iFreq*0.2
    
    aMix = (aFund + aHarm2*0.5 + aHarm3*0.3) * iAmp * 2
    
    outs aMix, aMix
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play filtered sweep
i1 0 4

; Play granular texture
i2 5 4

; Play noise percussion
i3 10 0.3
i3 10.5 0.3
i3 11 0.3
i3 11.5 0.3

; Play wind sound
i4 13 5

; Play ocean waves
i5 19 6

; Play crackling fire
i6 26 5

; Play vinyl crackle
i7 32 4

; Play metallic noise
i8 37 2
i8 39 2

; Play stereo field
i9 42 5

; Play noise with pitch
i10 48 2 220
i10 50 2 330
i10 52 2 440

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>
